TopicTitle: Is there a way to access the app icon file on IOS 8?

Articles.Content: I would like to try and experiment by adding my own custom icons for apps, but I cannot seem to fins the app icon file in iExplorer. Is there a way to access this file?

Backup your iDevice to iTunes, then go to Music/iTunes/iTunes Media/Mobile Applications. 

All of your apps should be there and have the extension .ipa, right click on one and open with an archive utility.

Find the .app inside the payload directory which is inside the unzipped directory, right click and hit show package contents.

There should be multiple icons at different resolutions, replace then with what you want.

That is all I know how to do, you can look at [this wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.ipa_%28file_extension%29) for more on .ipa files.
Ok, I was able to get to the image, but if I open i, it just says "There are no photos or videos selected." and if I drag it onto my desktop it appears as a blank image.
Also, none of the default apps show up, why is that?
I don't know why none of the default apps show up. What version of OS X are you using?

> 
> I don't know why none of the default apps show up. What version of OS X are you using?

I am using Windows 8
can it only be done on OS X?
